stimulusHtml: Which of the following correctly describes the income effect associated with the law of demand?
choicesHtml: If consumer income increases, there will be an upward movement along the demand curve for a normal good.
If consumer income increases, the demand curve will shift to the right for an inferior good.
If the price of a good increases, the demand for the good decreases because the demand for its substitute in consumption increases.
If the price of a good decreases, the demand for the good increases because the lower price increases the demand for its complement in consumption.
If the price of a normal good decreases, the purchasing power of a consumerâ€™s income increases and therefore consumers will be willing and able to purchase more of the good.
